abstract: A flood of new devices and software has made text-to-speech technology cheaper and more accessible to those with speech impairments.
snippet: A flood of new devices and software has made text-to-speech technology cheaper and more accessible to those with speech impairments.
lead_paragraph: Update | 9/19/09 10:10 p.m.  Kara Lynn, who was featured in a Times article because she was using an iPhone for text-to-speech service, offers her own comment about the technological curve.

headline.main: Text-to-Speech Technology Reaches an Inflection Point
